intro: Anthemis pindicola, commonly known as the Pindus Anthemis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to harsh alpine conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Anthemis pindicola is considered a rare and endemic species.
